== Introduction ==

Our goal is to be the '''largest, most successful and respected''' Ubuntu community in the '''world'''. You can help make that happen.

Ubuntu Vancouver was founded in April 2008 with the original goal of organizing a Hardy Heron Release Party. Since then we have decided to do much, much more:
** Advocate - Raise awareness about Ubuntu and promote its adoption all over Vancouver
** Offer Support - Make the Ubuntu experience the best that it can be for residents of the Vancouver community
** Develop - Gather the best artists, programmers, translators, documenters, and Ubuntu enthusiasts to make Ubuntu the most compelling system anywhere!
** Educate - Give presentations and classes about Ubuntu
** Party - Whenever we can find an excuse (which is often) 
<<BR>><<BR>>
== Contact ==

Would you like to join the group? We have an official '''membership''' site at: <nowiki>[[http://www.meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver]]</nowiki>. Please sign up there! It's free and easy. When you join the group you will have access to a wide range of events and activities. Be part of the fun!
<<BR>>

All members are strongly encouraged to join our mailing list <nowiki>[[http://www.meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver/messages/archive/| by clicking here.]]</nowiki> To post a message to our official email list <nowiki>[[http://www.meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver/messages/archive/|Click this link.]]</nowiki>

There's a (more technical) team page on Launchpad.net (the main site where Ubuntu teams gather to tackle projects): <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-vancouver-loco]]</nowiki>
Join us there if you would like to report/work on bugs/projects/blueprints with us!

We are also on '''identi.ca''' (It's like Twitter but better.)
<nowiki>[[http://identi.ca/group/ubuntuvancouver]]</nowiki>
<<BR>>''Though it's not strictly necessary, you are encouraged to get an account (it's free) and follow !ubuntuvancouver updates and breaking news.''

== How to Contribute ==

'''<nowiki>[[http://www.meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver/messages/archive/| Join our mailing list. ]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/CanadianTeam/Vancouver#Next%20General%20Meeting| Come to a meeting]]</nowiki>. Everyone is welcome.'''

Between meetings, tell everyone you know about us. Spread the word. 

Generate real '''BUZZ''' by helping our Marketing team. Email <nowiki>[[mailto:randall@executiv.es?subject=uvEAM%20BUZZ|Randall]]</nowiki> (our Buzz Generator) for more information about how you can help Ubuntu Vancouver Evangelism Advocacy & Marketing (uvEAM). <nowiki>[[CanadianTeam-Vancouver-uvEAM|The uVEAM page is here.]]</nowiki>
<<BR>><<BR>>
== Need Help With Ubuntu? ==
'''Ubuntu Vancouver strives to offer support to residents of Vancouver (and surrounding areas) who are having difficulties with Ubuntu.''' Support is volunteer-based, best-effort, and without warranty. Please visit our <nowiki>[[CanadianTeam-Vancouver-GetSupport|Support Page]]</nowiki> for more information

<<BR>>

We have many events and meetings every month! Check our meetup site at http://meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver/calendar

== Resources ==

<nowiki>[[CanadianTeam-Vancouver-GeneralResources|This page]]</nowiki> is a great place to start if you're looking for links and information that have been hand-selected by Ubuntu Vancouver experts. There's a lot of other great resources on our http://meetup.com/ubuntuvancouver page too, so join and take a look!

If you are new to Ubuntu or the concept of free software, we suggest that you begin by reading the <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ubuntu|Wikipedia entry for Ubuntu.]]</nowiki>

== Team Reports ==

Ubuntu Vancouver's <nowiki>[[CanadianTeam-Vancouver-ReportingPage|Team Reporting Page]]</nowiki> is a concise summary of our activities. It is used to report our major accomplishments out to the global Ubuntu community. If you have attended our meetings and followed our mailing list you will likely already know what these are. If you have contributed to the Ubuntu community and you live in/around Vancouver BC, please feel free to send us a note and we'll get your accomplishment(s) on the list too.
